idioms.meaning: punishing a crime to make an example for others

idioms.reading: うたがわしきはばっせず
idioms.meaning: we are innocent until proven guilty

lessons.japanese: 君が彼を罰するのは筋違いだと思った。
lessons.indonesian: We thought it wrong that you should punish him.

lessons.japanese: 規則違反をする者は罰せられるだろう。
lessons.indonesian: Those who violate the rules will be punished.

lessons.japanese: ああいうルールに反する人は罰せられるよ。
lessons.indonesian: Those who violate the rules will be punished.

lessons.japanese: 規則に当てはめて彼を罰した。
lessons.indonesian: We punished him according to the rules.

lessons.japanese: 危険な運転は罰せられるべきだ。
違法駐車で２０ドルの罰金を科せられました。
lessons.indonesian: I was fined 20 dollars for illegal parking.

lessons.japanese: 駐車違反で20ドルの罰金をとられた。
lessons.indonesian: I was fined 20 dollars for illegal parking.

lessons.japanese: 圧倒的多数がその残酷な刑罰を廃止することに票を投じた。
lessons.indonesian: An overwhelming majority voted to abolish the brutal punishment.

lessons.japanese: もし彼が罪を犯したのなら、罰せられるべきだ。
lessons.indonesian: He ought to be punished if he committed a crime.

lessons.japanese: もし君がここに駐車していたなら、罰金を科せられていただろう。
lessons.indonesian: If you had parked your car here, you would have been fined.

lessons.japanese: もう勝負は決まった。男らしく罰を受けようではないか。
lessons.indonesian: The jig is up; let's face the music like men.

lessons.japanese: ホワイト先生は少年を試験のカンニングで罰した。
lessons.indonesian: Mr White punished the boy for cheating on the examination.
